etymology.description: semantic 广 (‘building’) + phonetic 車; simplified from 庫 (車 → 车).
etymology.interpretation: 广 evokes a building or shelter, pointing to a place used for keeping things. 車 provided the historical sound and nudges the meaning toward storage of goods or equipment. Over time the sense broadened to general storehouses and reservoirs.
etymology.simplification: Component simplification: 車 was replaced by 车 while the semantic 广 stayed the same, preserving the phono-semantic structure.

examples.chinese: 我们把货物搬进仓库(我們把貨物搬進倉庫)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bǎ huòwù bān jìn cāngkù.
examples.english: We moved the goods into the warehouse.

examples.chinese: 这座水库为城市供水(這座水庫為城市供水)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò shuǐkù wèi chéngshì gōngshuǐ.
examples.english: This reservoir supplies water to the city.

examples.chinese: 车库里停着两辆车(車庫裡停著兩輛車)。
examples.pinyin: Chēkù lǐ tíngzhe liǎng liàng chē.
examples.english: Two cars are parked in the garage.
